au.edu.apsr.mtk.base
Class METS

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.apsr.mtk.base.METSElement
      au.edu.apsr.mtk.base.METS

public class METS
extends METSElement

Class representing the METS root element

When needing to create a METS object from an existing source stream, use the METSReader class to create a DOM object, wrap the DOM in the METSWrapper class, then obtain the METS object from the METSWrapper. For example:

METSReader mr = new METSReader();

mr.mapToDOM(inputStream);

METSWrapper mw = new METSWrapper(mr.getMETSDocument());

METS mets = mw.getMETSObject();

Author:
Scott Yeadon

Method Detail

newMetsHdr

public MetsHdr newMetsHdr()
                   throws METSException
Return an empty MetsHdr The returned object has no properties or content and is not part of the METS document, it is essentially a constructor of a METS element which is owned by the METS document. The returned object needs to be "filled out" (e.g. with id, additional sub-elements, etc) before being added to the METS document.

Throws:
METSException

addDmdSec

public DmdSec addDmdSec(DmdSec dmdSec)
Add a dmdSec. If a dmdSec with the same id already exists it is replaced with the new one and returned to the caller

Parameters:
dmdSec - a DmdSec object
Returns:
DmdSec Any existing dmdSec having an ID attribute value matching the id of the dmdSec to add. If an entry does not exist null is returned.

removeDmdSec

public DmdSec removeDmdSec(java.lang.String id)
Remove a dmdSec with the ID provided

Parameters:
id - the id of the DmdSec to remove
Returns:
DmdSec The dmdSec having an ID attribute value matching the id passed in. If not found null is returned.

Parameters:
id - the id of the DmdSec to search for
Returns:
boolean true if a dmdSec with the given id is found else false
